Chicken Katsu Curry

Curry Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Onion Paste 3 Tablespoons 
Garlic 1 Teaspoons 
Bread Crumb (Panko) 1/2 Cup 
Egg 1 Numbers 
Salt To Taste 
Pepper Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Chicken Breast 500 Grams 
Soya Sauce 1 Teaspoons 
Honey 1/2 Teaspoons 
Chicken Stock 1 Cup 
Butter Milk 1 Cup

First take chicken breast in this add butter milk, salt put it in the refrigerator for over night. Take some flour season with pepper powder and salt, Coat the chicken breast in flour, shaking off any excess, dip them into the egg, and then press into the bread crumb until well coated on both sides, and deep fry them. Make sauce: Heat a pan add garlic and butter, add onion paste, cook it for some time, add curry powder, Soya sauce, honey, chicken stock, mix it well cook it for a minute, cut them chicken in to slices and pour sauce in to the fried chicken. Serve this with rice.
Coconut pan cake

Sugar as needed 
Salt pinch 
Cadodom Powder pinch 
Coconut Grated Fresh 1 Cup 
Maida 1 Cup 
Egg 1 Numbers 
Milk 2 Cup

1. Take a bowl add the Grated fresh coconut, salt, sugur, cardadom powder and mix well and keep a side. In another bowl add egg, salt, sugar, cardadom powder milk mix well and then add the maida mix well into thin batter. Now heat the pan add butter and pour the batter and make into a thin dosa after few min, \n2. spread the coconut mixture in the center and spread once the dosa is done close the coconut mixture from both the ends and remove from the pan. serve hot with honey
Smoked Salmon Sushi Roll

Japanese Sushi Rice 2 Cup 
Rice Wine Vinegar 6 Tablespoons 
Sheets Nori (dry Seaweed) 6 Numbers 
Avocado - Peeled, Pitted And Sliced 1 Numbers 
Cucumber, Peeled And Sliced 1 Numbers 
Smoked Salmon, Cut Into Long Strips 8 Numbers 
Wasabi Paste 2 Tablespoons

1.Soak rice for 4 hours. Drain rice and cook in a rice cooker with 2 cups of water. Rice must be slightly dry as vinegar will be added later. 
2.Immediately after rice is cooked, mix in 6 tablespoons rice vinegar to the hot rice. Spread rice on a plate until completely cool. 
3.Place 1 sheet of seaweed on bamboo mat, press a thin layer of cool rice on the seaweed. Leave at least 1/2 inch top and bottom edge of the seaweed uncovered. This is for easier sealing later. Dot some wasabi on the rice. Arrange cucumber, avocado and smoked salmon to the rice. Position them about 1 inch away from the bottom edge of the seaweed. 
4.Slightly wet the top edge of the seaweed. Roll from bottom to the top edge with the help of the bamboo mat tightly. Cut roll into 8 equal pieces and serve. Repeat for other rolls.
Miso Soup

Dashi Granules 2 Teaspoons 
Water 4 Cup 
Miso Paste 3 Tablespoons 
Package Silken Tofu, Diced 1 Numbers 
Green Onions, Sliced Diagonally 2 Numbers

1.In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine dashi granules and water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium, and whisk in the miso paste. Stir in tofu. Separate the layers of the green onions, and add them to the soup. Simmer gently for 2 to 3 minutes before serving.
Miso Braised Pork

Canola Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Pork Butt (shoulder Roast) 5 Pound 
Minced Garlic 2 Tablespoons 
Minced Ginger 1 Teaspoons 
Water, More If Needed 2 Cup 
Soy Sauce 1/3 Cup 
Brown Sugar 1/3 Cup 
White (shiro) Miso 3/4 Cup

1.Heat canola oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat until hot. Sear pork slices until well browned on both sides, then remove. Stir in the garlic and ginger, cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the water, soy sauce, brown sugar, and miso; bring to a simmer, scraping the bottom of the pan to dissolve the caramelized juices. \n2.Place pork into pot, add additional water if needed to cover pork with the sauce. Then, reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 3 hours until the pork is tender, and the sauce has thickened.
Chakin Sushi

Sushi Rice, Or Japanese Short-grain White Rice 1 Cup 
Eggs, Beaten 3 Numbers 
Salt 1/4 Teaspoons 
Vegetable Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Rice Vinegar 3 Tablespoons 
White Sugar 2 Tablespoons 
Salt 1 Teaspoons 
Black Sesame Seeds 2 Tablespoons 
Sprigs Italian Parsley With Long Stems 6 Numbers

1.In a saucepan bring water to a boil. Add rice and stir. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Once cooked, spoon rice into a large bowl and allow to cool until it is cool enough to handle. 
2.Meanwhile, beat eggs together with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Brush the bottom of a skillet with vegetable oil, and place over medium heat. Once hot, pour in 1/6 of the egg mixture and spread evenly over the bottom of the pan. Cook until the egg has just firmed, then carefully flip over and cook for a few more seconds to firm the other side. Repeat with remaining egg to create 6 thin sheets. 
3.Stir together vinegar, sugar, and 1 teaspoon salt in a small bowl. Microwave for a few seconds until the mixture is hot; stir until the sugar has dissolved. Fold vinegar and sesame seeds into warm rice. 
4.To assemble, place a large spoonful of rice into the center of each egg sheet. Fold into a square, and tie with a sprig of Italian parsley to secure.
Asari Sakamushi

Water 2 Cup 
Salt 1 Teaspoons 
Fresh Asari Clam 1 Pound 
Sake 2 Tablespoons

Put water and salt in a bowl. Soak asari in the water overnight. Wash asari in water and drain. Put asari in a pan and pour sake. Place a lid and steam asari on high heat for few minutes until clams are open.

Buri (yellowtail) Fillets 4 Numbers 
Daikon Radish 1 Lbs 
Chunk Fresh Ginger Root 1 Numbers 
Soy Sauce 4 Tablespoons 
Sake 1 Tablespoons 
Sugar 2 Tablespoons 
Mirin 3 Tablespoons

Pour boiled water over buri and drain. Peel daikon radish and cut into medium chunks. Slice ginger root. Put about 3 cups of water in a pan and simmer daikon with ginger slices. Add buri, soy sauce, sugar, sake, and mirin in the pan.
Sweet and Sour Crab Omelet

Crabmeat 1/4 Lbs 
Eggs 6 Numbers 
Boiled Bamboo Shoot 1/4 Lbs 
Chunk Ginger Root 1 Numbers 
Water 1/2 Cup 
Rice Wine Vinegar 1 Tablespoons 
Soy Sauce 1 Tablespoons 
Sesame Oil 1 Teaspoons 
Mixture Of Water And 1 Tablespoons 
Katakuriko/corn Starch 1 Tablespoons

Shred crabmeat in a bowl. Cut bamboo shoot and ginger into thin stripps. Beat eggs in a bowl and add crabmeat, bamboo shoot, and ginger in it. Mix water, soy sauce, sugar, and rice wine vinegar in a pan and bring to a boil. Put katakuriko mixture in the pan and stir quickly and stop the heat. Heat sesame oil in a large frying pan/wok. Pour egg mixture in the pan and make an omelette, stirring. Turn the omelette over. Serve the omelette in a plate and pour sweet and sour sauce over.
Baked Oyster

Oyster 1 Lbs 
Enoki Mushroom 1 Numbers 
Onion 1 Numbers 
Spinach 1/4 Pound 
Butter 3 Tablespoons 
Flour 3 To Taste 
Milk 2 Cup 
Chicken Bouillon Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Parmesan Cheese 2 Tablespoons

Wash oyster with salt. Slice onion thinly. Cut enoki mushroom and spinach into bite-sized pieces. Put butter in a frying pan and saute enoki mushroom, onion slices, and spinach. Add flour in the pan and stir well.
Simmered Flat Fish

Karei (flat Fish) Or White Fish 4 Numbers 
Sake 1/3 Cup 
Water 1/2 Cup 
Soysauce 4 Tablespoons 
Sugar 1 Tablespoons 
Mirin 2 Tablespoons 
Grated Ginger 1 Teaspoons
Put water, sake, soysauce, mirin, and sugar in a pan and bring to a boil. Add fish in the pan and simmer for 10 min. on medium heat. Add ginger in the pan and stop the heat.

Sheets Dried Konbu 4 Numbers 
Salmon 1/2 Pound 
Kanpyo 1 Ounces 
Water 3 Cup 
Soysauce 5 Tablespoons 
Sugar 4 Tablespoons 
Sake 3 Tablespoons

Soak konbu in water for 10 min. (save this water) Soak kanpyo in water for 5 min. Cut salmon into the same width as the konbu. Put a piece of salmon on top of a sheet of konbu and roll it. Tie the konbu roll by a short strip of kanpyo. Put the konbu roll in a pan. Pour the water used for soaking the konbu in the pan. Simmer the konbu roll on low heat for an hour. Add sugar, sake, and soysauce and simmer for 30 min. Turn off the heat.
Maguro Zukedon

Rice 2 Cup 
Avocado 2 Numbers 
Maguro Sashimi (raw Tuna) 1/2 Tablespoons 
Soy Sauce 3 Tablespoons 
Wasabi Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Shiso Japanese Basil 4 Piece 
Sesame Seed 1 Tablespoons

Cook japanse rice. Slice maguro thinly. Mix wasabi and soy sauce and marinate maguro slices in the mixture. Peel avocado and cut into bite-sized pieces. Cut shiso into thin strips. Put cooked rice in a bowl and place marinated maguro slices and avocado on top. Sprinkle shiso and sesame over the ingredients. Pour some soy sauce and wasabi mixture over the toppings before eating.
Boiled Octopus 1/2 Pound Cucumber 1 Numbers Yellow Bell Pepper 1 Numbers Rice Wine Vinegar 1 1/2 Olive Oil 1 1/2

Cut boiled octopus into bite-sized pieces. Cut cucumber and bell pepper into thin stripps. Soak octopus, cucumber, and bell pepper in ice water. Drain the ingredients and serve in a bowl. Mix rice wine vinegar and oil in a small bowl and pour over the salad.
Salmon Oshizushi

Sushi Rice 3 Cup 
Smoked Salmon 10 Slice 
Sake Rice Wine 1 Teaspoons 
Lemon Juice 1 Teaspoons

Sprinkle sake and lemon juice over smoked salmon slices and set aside for 10 min. Spread a sheet of plastic wrap at the bottom and sides of a tupperware. Press sushi rice in the tupperware and flatten. Place salmon slices on top of the rice. Cover the sushi with a sheet of plastic wrap and press the sushi with a sheet of cardboard paper which is cut into the same size as the tupperware. After firming sushi, take out sushi from the tupperware and cut into bite-sized pieces and serve.
Soft Fried Shrimp

Shrimps 8 Numbers 
Egg Whites 2 Numbers 
Flour 1 Tablespoons 
Katakuriko Starch 4 Tablespoons 
Salt And Pepper To Taste

Remove heads and shells from shrimps without removing tails. Devein the shrimps. Make two or three incisions in the stomach sides of the shrimps to straighten them. Put egg whites in a bowl and whisk until stiff. Add flour and katakuriko flour in the egg whites and mix quickly. Dip shrimps in the batter and fry them in 280 F oil until brown. Serve shrimps with chili sauce or ketchup.
Stuffed Squid

Squids 4 Numbers 
Water 2 1/2 Cup 
Sake 1/3 Cup 
Soysauce 3 Tablespoons 
Mirin 3 Tablespoons 
For Filling: 
Chicken Breasts (boneless and Skinless) 
Minced Onion 1/3 Cup 
Egg 1 Numbers 
Flour 3 Tablespoons 
Soy Sauce 1 Tablespoons

Remove guts and legs from squids and clean the squids. Chop the legs into small pieces. Mince chicken breast and add flour, minced onion, soysauce, egg, and chipped squid legs and mix well. Stuff the filling in each squid and close the pocket using a toothpick. Make a couple of cuts on top of each squid. Put water, sake, mirin, and soysauce in a pan. Add squids in the pan and simmer on low heat for about 30 minutes
Squid and Broccoli Stir-fry

Squid 2 Numbers 
Broccoli 1 Numbers 
Ginger 1/2 Clove 
Chicken Soup Stock 2/3 Cup 
Sake 1 Tablespoons 
Soy Sauce 1 Teaspoons 
Sugar 1/3 Teaspoons 
Salt 2/3 Teaspoons 
Vegetable Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Water 2 Teaspoons 
Katakuriko Starch 2 Teaspoons

Prepare squid for cooking and cut them into bite-sized pieces, including legs. *How to Prepare Squid \nCut broccoli into bite-sized pieces and boil them. Mince fresh ginger. Mix sugar, salt, sake, and soy sauce in chicken soup stock and set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a wok and saute ginger. Add broccoli in the pan and stir-fry them. Add squid and soup in the pan and bring to boil. Pour mixture of water and katakuriko starch over the ingredients and stir quickly. Stop the heat
Tempura Shrimp

Shrimps 12 Large 
Egg 1 Numbers 
All Purpose Flour 1 Cup 
Ice Water 1 Cup 
Vegetable Oil To Fry

Remove heads and shells from shrimps without removing tails. Devein the shrimps. Make two or three incisions in the stomach sides of the shrimps to straighten them. Lightly press the back of shrimps to straighten. Remove the dirt from the tails of shrimps, using a knife. Dry shrimps on paper towels. Make tempura batter. Heat the oil to 340F degree. Shrimp and Cucumber

Cucumber 1 Numbers 
Shrimp 1/4 Pound 
Vinegar 1/3 Cup 
Sugar 2 Tablespoons 
Sake 1 Teaspoons
Cut cucumber into thin round slices. Pour boiled water over shrimp in a strainer. Mix vinegar, sugar, and sake in a bowl. Add cucumber slices and shrimp in the bowl and mix well.
